title: NFZ
description:
Nfz is the restricted volume for crossing by drones.
Nfz can be static and can be dynamic.
A static NFZ is a constraint area that does not represent air vehicle flight.
Dynamiv NFZ is the area restricted by air vehicle that may allow only the specific air vehicle to cross.

nfzId.description:
Unique NFZ ID within the UTM scope or other system scope.
In order to make other system nfz id unique at the UTM the other system id will get a prefix of the USS id that own the nfz

minAlt.description:
The min altitude of the NFZ in meters ASL.
If the field is not sent the min alt is considered as the ground level (no min alt)

maxAlt.description:
The max altitude of the NFZ in meters ASL.
If the field is not sent the max alt is considered as unlimited (no max alt) meaning the the area can't be crossed from above.

nfzPolygon.description:
The polygon geo points.
The alt of each point is disregards and only min and max NFZ altitude is considered

allowedId.description:
The drone Id that is allowed to cross or use the NFZ area for flight.
If the field not sent then no drone is allowed

nfzType.description:
The NFZ type - static or dynamic.
If the field not sent then "Static" is considered by the UTM

description.description: Free text to describe the NFZ

origin.description: The NFZ belongs to specific USS or belongs to the UTM area
